content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?>   <metadata>     <idinfo>       <citation>         <citeinfo>           <origin>NOAA CoastWatch Program - NOAA National Environmental Satellite Data and Information Service</origin>           <pubdate>20050808</pubdate>           <pubtime>000000Z</pubtime>           <title>Pathfinder SST</title>           <edition>One</edition>           <geoform>map (GIF, PDF), raster digital data (HDF, MAT, NetCDF), tabular digital data (ASCII), vector digital data (XYZ)</geoform>           <pubinfo>             <pubplace>Pacific Grove, CA</pubplace>             <publish>NOAA CoastWatch Program, West Coast Regional Node</publish>           </pubinfo>           <onlink> http://coastwatch.pfel.noaa.gov</onlink>         </citeinfo>       </citation>       <descript>         <abstract>AVHRR Pathfinder Oceans Project seeks to create a long-term, continuous sea surface temperature data series for use in climate research.  The Pathfinder SST data begins with historic AVHRR Global Area Coverage SST.  This data is re-evaluated and re-calibrated, improving both the accuracy and number of valid SST values (due to improved cloud-masking). The units of the data are degree C.</abstract>         <purpose>Products are intended for federal, state, and local government environmental decision makers. Other uses include recreational boating, educators, resource managers, and researchers. Products are validated with in situ measurements to quantify their accuracy.</purpose>         <supplinf>For further information on the data set, including a description of processing steps, calibration and validation methods, and references, see the Pre-Dissemination Review.  These documents will be available on the website in the future.  Users should note that data marked as clouds could be either clouds or missing data. </supplinf>       </descript>       <timeperd>         <timeinfo>             <rngdates>               <begdate>19850101</begdate>               <begtime>000000Z</begtime>               <enddate>20051231</enddate>               <endtime>000000Z</endtime>             </rngdates>           </timeinfo>         <current>none</current>       </timeperd>       <status>         <progress>Complete</progress>         <update>None planned</update>       </status>       <spdom>         <bounding>           <westbc>-180.0</westbc>           <eastbc>180.0</eastbc>           <northbc>75.0</northbc>           <southbc>-75.0</southbc>         </bounding>       </spdom>       <keywords>         <theme>          <themekt>none</themekt><themekey>NOAA CoastWatch</themekey><themekey>Pathfinder</themekey><themekey>AVHRR</themekey><themekey>Global Area Coverage</themekey>        </theme>         <temporal>           <tempkt>none</tempkt>           <tempkey>8-day, monthly</tempkey>         </temporal>       </keywords>       <accconst>none</accconst>       <useconst>Not intended for legal use. formats.</formname>             <filedec>Compressed files are compressed using ZIP method. </filedec>           </digtinfo>           <digtopt>             <onlinopt>               <computer>                 <networka>                   <networkr>All data is accessible through the CoastWatch, West Coast Regional Node website: http://coastwatch.pfel.noaa.gov.  Primary access to the data is through the CoastWatch Browser.  The CoastWatch Browser is a web page for selecting, viewing, and downloading near-real-time satellite data and other data for the west coast of the U.S. and Mexico. It creates custom maps on-the-fly of the data that you select. The maps can include bathymetry contour lines, contour lines from other data sets, and vectors from other data sets. The data can be downloaded in several different data file formats. </networkr>                 </networka>               </computer>             </onlinopt>             <offoptn>               <offmedia>none</offmedia>               <recfmt>none</recfmt>               <compat>The ASCII format is recognized by most GIS software and common commercial spreadsheets.  The GIF format is recognized by most graphics applications.  The PDF format is a file format designed for electronic document display, and can be viewed using PDF viewing software.  The HDF format is recognized by image analysis programs including CDAT, a freely distributed viewing program provided by NOAA CoastWatch.  The MATLAB format is recognized by MathWorks MATLAB computing software.</compat>             </offoptn>           </digtopt>         </digform>         <fees>none</fees>       </stdorder>     </distinfo>     <metainfo>       <metd>20060301</metd>       <metc>         <cntinfo>           <cntorgp>             <cntorg>NOAA CoastWatch, West Coast Regional Node</cntorg>             <cntper>Dave Foley</cntper>           </cntorgp>           <cntpos>NOAA CoastWatch Coordinator, West Coast Regional Node</cntpos>           <cntaddr>             <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype>             <address>NOAA SWFSC Environmental Research Division (ERD), 1352 Lighthouse Ave.</address>             <city>Pacific Grove</city>             <state>California</state>             <postal>93950</postal>             <country>United States of America</country>           </cntaddr>           <cntvoice>831-648-0632</cntvoice>           <cntfax>831-648-8440</cntfax>           <cntemail>dave.foley@noaa.gov</cntemail>           <hours>Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm PST</hours>         </cntinfo>       </metc>       <metstdn> FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata </metstdn>       <metstdv> FGDC-STD-001-1998 </metstdv>       <mettc>universal time</mettc>     </metainfo>   </metadata>
